_prev_prog_3.Description: Supervalu's implementation of the PSM program includes employee education in the hazards of ammonia and measures that can be used to reduce employee and community exposure to accidental releases of ammonia. The plan includes a regular preventative maintenance program (Mechanical Integrity)for the components of the ammonia refrigeration system, and programs for Mangement of Change (MOC)to the ammonia refrigeration system, process hazard analysis (PHA),and Pre- Startup Safety Review. The program also includes operating procedures for the safe operation of the refrigeration system, specific requirements for safe work practices (such as safe approaches to weldingand similar hot work), and safety requiremenst for contractors (Contractor Qualifications)who may be hired to work on the refrigeration system. Supervalu has a procedure in place for perfroming incident investigations to ensure root causes are identified and corrective actions are taken to minimize the potential for the recurrence of incidents. The program also has a procedure for conducting Compliance Audits to ensure that the PSM program is being implemented at the facility. The PSM written program  also incoporates the facilities emergency response plan and places special emphasis on the handling of accidental releases of ammonia and coordination of emergency response activities with the local fire department and other emergency response organizations.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
KTR Capital Partners. - Harrisburg, PA Facility

General

The KTR Harrisburg, PA facility (formally Supervalu) located at 3900 Industrial Road is a combination of dry storage and refrigerated spaces. This property was purchased as an investment property by KTR late in 2010. The goal is to have the spaces, both dry and refrigerated; leased by a customer or customers who will then take over the responsibility for the facility as far as compliance is concerned. In the mean time KTR has adapted certain aspects of the existing Supervalu PSM Program, namely Training, Emergency Action Plan and Employee Participation. While recognizing the hazards of ammonia, KTR strives to maintain the safest refrigeration system possible in order to protect employees, neighbors and the environment. 

1.0    Identification of Covered Process - KTR - Harrisburg Facility employs anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant to maintain temperatures in the cold storage section of the warehouse. The overall plant charge is in excess of 10,000 Lbs., therefore, the OSHA Process Safety Management and EPA List Rule Applies.

2.0    Program Level - The ammonia refrigeration system falls under the Program 3 guidelines.

3.0    Management of Change - The management personnel with overall responsibility for the program is the Head of Property Management/construction.

4.0    Hazard Assessment - A hazard analysis has been performed on the Ammonia Refrigeration system. Three portions are included in this assessment.

4.1   Worst Case Scenario - The worst Case Scenario, as defined by the EPA; "the owner/operator shall assume that the maximum quantity in the largest vessel is released as a gas over 10 minutes, due to an unspecified failure."  Atmospheric dispersion modeling has been performed to determine the distance traveled by the anhydrous ammonia before its concentration decreases to the toxic end point of 0.14mg/L. As a result of the worst case evaluation, a radius of 0.8 miles has b

een determined and an affected population of 2,633. Please refer to the worse case section for specific details.

4.2   Alternative Case Scenario - The alternative case scenario was performed as above with the exception that the alternative case involves a liquid pipe leak of 5000 lbs over a 10 minute period. The result of this evaluation was a radius of 0.1 miles with an affected population of 0. Please refer to the alternative case section for specific details.
4.3   Five Year Accident History - Since KTR took over the facility in November of 2010 there have been no accidents. Accident history was not provided by the previous owner.

5.0    Accident Prevention Program - KTR - Harrisburg Facility is in full compliance with OSHA Process Safety Management guidelines for the method of Accident Prevention. The Accident Prevention and PSM Programs empha: operator training, preventative maintenance, state of the art equipment, use of accurate operating procedures, hazard reviews of the system, ammonia awareness, proper auditing program and inspection programs.

6.0    Emergency Response Program - KTR currently has an Emergency Action Plan. There are no employees at the facility at this time since the building is basically unoccupied. The facility is monitored 24hours a day, 7 days a week by a computer system that dials out to the owners and refrigeration Service Company if any parameters are violated. The refrigeration Service Company performs daily walkthroughs of the facility 5 days a week and has the ability to dial into the control system to monitor the refrigeration system remotely. The facility is monitored 24/7 by a private security agency.  The emergency action plan is reviewed annually and all parties are to be informed of any facility changes.
